checkboxes.desc: taught readers some important points about subjects
checkboxes.name: 2-0_overall

checkboxes.desc: taught readers information about a subject
checkboxes.name: 3-0_overall

checkboxes.desc: put in ideas, observations, and questions
checkboxes.name: 3-1_overall

checkboxes.desc: taught readers different things about a subject
checkboxes.name: 4-0_overall

checkboxes.desc: put one or more of facts, details, quotes, or ideas into each part of writing
checkboxes.name: 4-1_overall

checkboxes.desc: used different kinds of information to teach about the subject
checkboxes.name: 5-0_overall

checkboxes.desc: sometimes included little essays, stories, or how-to sections in writing
checkboxes.name: 5-1_overall

checkboxes.desc: wrote a beginning in which he named a subject and tried to interest readers
checkboxes.name: 2-0_lead

checkboxes.desc: wrote a beginning in which he got readers ready to learn a lot of information about the subject
checkboxes.name: 3-0_lead

checkboxes.desc: hooked her readers by explaining why the subject mattered, telling a surprising fact, or giving a big picture
checkboxes.name: 4-0_lead

checkboxes.desc: let readers know that she would teach them different things about a subject
checkboxes.name: 4-1_lead

checkboxes.desc: wrote an introduction in which he helped readers get interested in and understand the subject
checkboxes.name: 5-0_lead

checkboxes.desc: let readers know the subtopics that he would develop later as well as the sequence
checkboxes.name: 5-1_lead

checkboxes.desc: used words such as and and also to show she had more to say
checkboxes.name: 2-0_transitions

checkboxes.desc: used words to show sequence such as before, after, then, and later
checkboxes.name: 3-0_transitions

checkboxes.desc: used words to show what did not fit: however and but
checkboxes.name: 3-1_transitions

checkboxes.desc: used words in each section that helped readers understand how one piece of information connected with others
checkboxes.name: 4-0_transitions

checkboxes.desc: if he wrote the section in sequence, he used words and phrases such as before, later, next, then, and after
checkboxes.name: 4-1_transitions

checkboxes.desc: if he organized the section in kinds or parts, he used words such as another, also, and for example
checkboxes.name: 4-2_transitions

checkboxes.desc: when writing about results, used words and phrases such as consequently, as a result, and because of this
checkboxes.name: 5-0_transitions

checkboxes.desc: when compared information, she used phrases such as in contrast, by comparison, and especially
checkboxes.name: 5-1_transitions

checkboxes.desc: in narrative parts, she used phrases that go with stories such as a little later and three hours later
checkboxes.name: 5-2_transitions

checkboxes.desc: if she wrote sections that stated an opinion, she used words such as but the most important reason, for example, and consequently
checkboxes.name: 5-3_transitions

checkboxes.desc: wrote some sentences or a section at the end to wrap up his piece
checkboxes.name: 2-0_ending

checkboxes.desc: wrote an ending that drew conclusions, asked questions, or suggested ways readers might respond
checkboxes.name: 3-0_ending

checkboxes.desc: wrote an ending in which she reminded readers of her subject and may either have suggested a follow-up action or left readers with a final insight
checkboxes.name: 4-0_ending

checkboxes.desc: added thoughts, feelings, and questions about the subject at the end
checkboxes.name: 4-1_ending

checkboxes.desc: wrote a conclusion in which he restated the main points and may have offered a final thought or question for readers to consider
checkboxes.name: 5-0_ending

checkboxes.desc: writing had different parts. Each part told different information about the topic
checkboxes.name: 2-0_organization

checkboxes.desc: grouped her information into parts
checkboxes.name: 3-0_organization

checkboxes.desc: each part was mostly about one thing that connected to her topic
checkboxes.name: 3-1_organization

checkboxes.desc: emerging paragraphs
checkboxes.name: 3-2_organization

checkboxes.desc: each part supports whole topic
checkboxes.name: 3-3_organization

checkboxes.desc: used clear paragraphing
checkboxes.name: 4-0_organization

checkboxes.desc: information was mostly about the same topic
checkboxes.name: 4-1_organization

checkboxes.desc: may have used headings and subheadings
checkboxes.name: 4-2_organization

checkboxes.desc: organized writing into a sequence of separate sections giving equal weight to sections
checkboxes.name: 5-0_organization

checkboxes.desc: may have used headings and subheadings to highlight the separate sections
checkboxes.name: 5-1_organization

checkboxes.desc: wrote each section according to an organizational plan shaped partly by the genre of the section
checkboxes.name: 5-2_organization

checkboxes.desc: used different kinds of information in his writing such as facts, definitions, details, steps, and tips
checkboxes.name: 2-0_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: wrote facts, definitions, details, and observations about his topic and explained some of them
checkboxes.name: 3-0_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: taught her readers different things about the subject
checkboxes.name: 4-0_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: chose those subtopics because they were important and interesting
checkboxes.name: 4-1_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: included different kinds of facts and details such as numbers, names, and examples
checkboxes.name: 4-2_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: got her information from talking to people, reading books, and from her own knowledge and observations
checkboxes.name: 4-3_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: made choices about organization, perhaps using compare/contrast, cause/effect, or pro/con
checkboxes.name: 4-4_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: used diagrams, charts, headings, bold words, and definition boxes to help teach her readers
checkboxes.name: 4-5_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: explained different aspects of a subject
checkboxes.name: 5-0_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: included a variety of information such as examples, details, dates, and quotes
checkboxes.name: 5-1_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: used trusted sources and gave credit when appropriate
checkboxes.name: 5-2_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: made sure to research any details that would add to his writing
checkboxes.name: 5-3_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: worked to make his information understandable to readers
checkboxes.name: 5-4_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: to do this, he may have referred to earlier parts of his text and summarized background information
checkboxes.name: 5-5_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: let readers know when he was discussing facts and when he was offering his own thinking
checkboxes.name: 5-6_elaboration

checkboxes.desc: tried to include the words that showed she was an expert on the subject
checkboxes.name: 2-0_craft

checkboxes.desc: chose expert words to teach readers a lot about the subject
checkboxes.name: 3-0_craft

checkboxes.desc: taught information in a way to interest readers
checkboxes.name: 3-1_craft

checkboxes.desc: may have used drawings, captions, or diagrams
checkboxes.name: 3-2_craft

checkboxes.desc: made deliberate word choices to teach his readers
checkboxes.name: 4-0_craft

checkboxes.desc: may have done this by using and repeating key words about his topic
checkboxes.name: 4-1_craft

checkboxes.desc: when felt right to do so, the writer chose interesting comparisons and used figurative language to clarify his points
checkboxes.name: 4-2_craft

checkboxes.desc: made choices about which information was best to include or not include
checkboxes.name: 4-3_craft

checkboxes.desc: used a teaching tone
checkboxes.name: 4-4_craft

checkboxes.desc: may have used phrases such as that means ..., what that really means is ..., and let me explain
checkboxes.name: 4-5_craft

checkboxes.desc: made deliberate word choices to have an effect on her readers
checkboxes.name: 5-0_craft

checkboxes.desc: used the vocabulary of experts and explained key terms
checkboxes.name: 5-1_craft

checkboxes.desc: worked to include the exact phrase, comparison, or image that would explain information and concepts
checkboxes.name: 5-2_craft

checkboxes.desc: not only made choices about which details and facts to include but also made choices about how to convey her information so it would make sense to readers
checkboxes.name: 5-3_craft

checkboxes.desc: blended storytelling, summary, and other genres as needed and used text features
checkboxes.name: 5-4_craft

checkboxes.desc: used a consistent, inviting, teaching tone and varied her sentences to help readers take in and understand the information
checkboxes.name: 5-5_craft

checkboxes.desc: No spelling errors!
checkboxes.name: 0-0_spelling

checkboxes.desc: 1-3 spelling mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-1_spelling

checkboxes.desc: 4-6 spelling mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-2_spelling

checkboxes.desc: 7+ spelling mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-3_spelling

checkboxes.desc: contains incorrect usage of words
checkboxes.name: 0-4_spelling

checkboxes.desc: No punctuation errors!
checkboxes.name: 0-0_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: 1-3 punctuation mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-1_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: 4-6 punctuation mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-2_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: 7+ punctuation mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-3_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: contains end of sentence marker mistakes (period, question marks, etc.)
checkboxes.name: 0-4_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: contains mid-sentence punctuation mistakes (comma, quotes, colon, etc.)
checkboxes.name: 0-5_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: contains capitalization errors
checkboxes.name: 0-6_punctuation

checkboxes.desc: No grammar errors!
checkboxes.name: 0-0_grammar

checkboxes.desc: 1-3 mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-1_grammar

checkboxes.desc: 4-6 mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-2_grammar

checkboxes.desc: 7+ mistakes
checkboxes.name: 0-3_grammar

checkboxes.desc: contains pronoun errors / misuse
checkboxes.name: 0-4_grammar

checkboxes.desc: contains verb tense errors
checkboxes.name: 0-5_grammar

checkboxes.desc: contains subject/verb errors
checkboxes.name: 0-6_grammar

checkboxes.desc: contains run-on/fragments
checkboxes.name: 0-7_grammar
